intro: Hyoseris calyculata, commonly known as the yellow starburry, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Hyoseris calyculata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
